intro: Seriphidium santolinum var. simplicifolium, commonly known as the simple-leaved tansy. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves and yellow ray flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its compact growth habit and silvery foliage make it a distinctive ornamental plant. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
